title: NLDS Game 3: Braves stun Cardinals with ninth-inning rally after epic pitchers' duel
text:
CLOSE USA TODAY Sports' Larry Berger breaks down what Ronald Acuña Jr. means to the Atlanta Braves. USA TODAY

Taking a 1-0 lead into the ninth inning, St. Louis Cardinals closer Carlos Martinez surrendered three runs with two out in front of a stunned crowd at Busch Stadium, as the Atlanta Braves rallied to take a 2-1 series in the National League Division Series.

Adam Wainwright gave the Cardinals a tremendous start, tossing 7 ⅔ shutout innings with eight strikeouts before giving way to the bullpen. But Braves starter Mike Soroka was just as good, surrendering one run in seven innings and at one point retired 17 batters in a row.

Martinez gave up a leadoff double to Josh Donaldson in the ninth but then struck out Nick Markakis and Adeiny Hechavarría. On the first pitch to Dansby Swanson, the shortstop ripped a hanging slider into the left-field corner for a run-scoring double. With runners on second and third, Adam Duvall followed with a two-run single that gave the Braves a 3-1 advantage.

Turning point

Duvall, the hero in Game 2, fell behind 0-2 against Martinez – both swinging strikes –with the game tied and runners on second and third in the ninth. After fouling off a 99-mph fastball, Duvall dunked a single into center field that scored the go-ahead runs.

Man of the moment

Bearing the expectations of a No. 1 overall pick, Swanson has been scrutinized through the years. But in the biggest moment of his young career, the 25-year-old came through with the game-tying double in the ninth.

"I love Dansby in those situations. I always have," Braves manager Brian Snitker said postgame. "That kid lives for that moment. And he's been big for us the last few years since he's been up."

State of the series

Atlanta moves to the brink of the NLCS, while St. Louis is suddenly playing to save its season. The Braves haven't announced a starter yet for Monday's Game 4, but they could bring back Game 1 starter Dallas Keuchel on three days' rest, or turn to Julio Teheran who was originally left off the NLDS roster.

The Braves haven't won a postseason series since 2001.
description: Atlanta scored three runs with two outs in the ninth against St. Louis closer Carlos Martinez to win 3-1 in NLDS Game 3.
